de.griefed.serverpackcreator.utilities

Class JarUtilities

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.griefed.serverpackcreator.utilities.JarUtilities

  • public class JarUtilities
extends java.lang.Object
    Some utilities used across ServerPackCreator, revolving around interacting with JAR-files.

      Copy a folder from inside our JAR to the host filesystem, using a source and a destination.
      This method is used in case we are running in a dev environment, where files are not wrapped in a JAR-file, but instead exist as regular files on the host filesystem, thus enabling us to iterate through 'em.

    • Method Detail

      • copyFileFromJar

        public void copyFileFromJar(java.io.File fileToCopy)
        Copy a file from inside our JAR-file to the host filesystem. The file will create exactly as specified in the parameter.
        Example:
        copyFileFromJar(new File("log4j2.xml")) will result in the log4j2.xml file from inside the JAR-file to be copied to the outside of the JAR-file as log4j2.xml
        Parameters:
        fileToCopy - File. The source-file in the JAR you wish to copy outside the JAR.

      • retrieveJarFromClass

        public java.util.jar.JarFile retrieveJarFromClass(java.lang.Class<?> classToRetrieveJarFor)
                                           throws java.io.IOException
        Retrieve the JAR-file for a given class.
        Parameters:
        classToRetrieveJarFor - The class to retrieve the JAR-file path for.
        Returns:
        JarFile. Returns the JarFile for the given class.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Thrown if the JAR-file could not be determined or otherwise accessed.

      • copyFolderFromJar

        public void copyFolderFromJar(java.lang.String jarPath,
                              java.lang.String directoryToCopy,
                              java.lang.String destinationDirectory,
                              java.lang.String jarDirectoryPrefix)
                       throws java.io.IOException
        Copy a folder from inside a JAR-file to the host filesystem. The specified folder will be copied, along with all resources inside it, recursively, to the specified destination.
        Parameters:
        jarPath - String. Path to either the JAR-file from which to copy a folder from, or to the class when running in a dev-environment. This parameter decides whether copyFolderFromJar(String, String) or copyFolderFromJar(JarFile, String, String, String) is called.
        Example for JAR-file: /home/griefed/serverpackcreator/serverpackcreator.jar
        Example for dev-environment: G:/GitLab/ServerPackCreator/build/classes/java/main
        See Main.main(String[]) source code for an example on how this is acquired automatically.
        directoryToCopy - String. Path to the directory inside the JAR-file you want to copy.
        destinationDirectory - String. Path to the destination directory you want to copy source to.
        jarDirectoryPrefix - String. A prefix to remove when checking for existence of source inside the JAR-file. For example, the ServerPackCreator files inside it's JAR-File are located in BOOT-INF/classes due to SpringBoot. In order to correctly scan for source, we need to remove that prefix, so we receive a path that looks like a regular path inside a JAR-file.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Exception thrown by copyFolderFromJar(JarFile, String, String, String)

      • copyFolderFromJar

        private void copyFolderFromJar(java.util.jar.JarFile jarToCopyFrom,
                               java.lang.String directoryToCopy,
                               java.lang.String destinationDirectory,
                               java.lang.String jarDirectoryPrefix)
                        throws java.io.IOException
        Copy a folder from inside a JAR-file to the host filesystem. The specified folder will be copied, along with all resources inside it, recursively, to the specified destination.
        This method is used when we are running in a JAR-file.
        Parameters:
        jarToCopyFrom - JarFile. The JAR-file to copy directoryToCopy to destinationDirectory from.
        directoryToCopy - String. Path to the directory inside the JAR-file you want to copy.
        destinationDirectory - String. Path to the destination directory you want to copy source to.
        jarDirectoryPrefix - String. A prefix to remove when checking for existence of source inside the JAR-file. For example, the ServerPackCreator files inside it's JAR-File are located in BOOT-INF/classes due to SpringBoot. In order to correctly scan for source, we need to remove that prefix, so we receive a path that looks like a regular path inside a JAR-file.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Thrown if no streams of the files can be created, indicating that they are inaccessible for some reason.

      • copyFolderFromJar

        private void copyFolderFromJar(java.lang.String source,
                               java.lang.String destination)
        Copy a folder from inside our JAR to the host filesystem, using a source and a destination.
        This method is used in case we are running in a dev environment, where files are not wrapped in a JAR-file, but instead exist as regular files on the host filesystem, thus enabling us to iterate through 'em.
        Parameters:
        source - File. The source-file in the JAR you wish to copy outside the JAR.
        destination - File. The destination where the source-file should be copied to.
